attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern~

Regarding the proposed increase in USCIS fee specifically related to the I-171H
and fingerprinting, I respectfully request that fees NOT be raised at this time.

The USCIS is currently recieving fees double the 545.00/I-171H and the $70.00
fingerprinting fee, as the I-171 and fingerprints are expiring prior to our ability to get
a foreign (Chinese) adopted child home.

Each family currently adopting from China has to apply for their 171 and do
fingerprints and then RE-DO them, giving the USCIS twice the amount usually
required to bring into the U.S. a child adopted oversees, as the wait times in
China have extended to 18 months and sometimes longer.
Adoption is already a HUGE expense for families. To raise fees, at this time, puts
an extra burden on us, beyond what is customary.

If fees need to be raised, then I would propose that the length of time the I-171 is
good for be extended to 24 months, and the fingerprinting be extended to 24
months.

Sincerely,
Tina Proper
Adoptive Parent

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Tina R. Proper
